subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Box user concerns.
author: Frank Sumption
full_text:
--_15020fd2-1046-4d7c-aa5b-3ebfc961055b_
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="Windows-1252"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable


 I think the price is mostly cuz it's still limited production. If someone=
 was pumping out thousands, or millions it would be much cheaper.  It costs=
 me maybe $100 to make one of mine, but that doesn't include the time it ta=
kes to put it together. Even at $500 I would be reluctant to sell the boxes=
, just because of the time it takes.
 
 Frank-S


To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.c=
omFrom: lisby@...: Sat, 24 Nov 2007 10:51:34 -0500Subject: Re=
: [EVP-ITC] Box user concerns.




I also meant to add that this mini-box i=
s hardly going into mass production. If you want one, you have to cough up =
$400-$500, just like I just did. That fee alone is enough to deter casual u=
sers. The people who buy these are not going to buy them on a whim. 

Ann

=

On Nov 24, 2007, at 12:07 AM, Frank Sumption wrote:




 It's not that con=
cerns are not considered, I think no one knows what to do with it. There's =
not enough box users, and ITC researchers out there to really good feel for=
 what the pitfalls are. So far after seven years of EVP/ITC work I can say =
onlly that these dark entities, or wahtever it is talk bad, and threaten, a=
nd that's about all they do. They threaten, I tell them to bring it, and...=
.nothin'! Paper tigers I say.   As far as some fears that portals are opene=
d, and all kinds of evil comes in, I don't believe that either. They are al=
ready have full access, they already exist in more demensions, making this =
physical level about the lowest level of spiritual existence/evolution. Jus=
t about all these worries are old fear crap to keep people in church.   I d=
on't think it's fair to with hold the stuff cuz of a few nut jobs, you have=
 the same problem with everything from bicycles to airplanes.   I had that =
concern about selling my boxes, but how would you screen users? You can't. =
Not everyone can use a quija board, and not too many unbalanced ding dongs =
get in trouble with those anyway.  Frank-S


To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.comFro=
m: babiarz3@...: Fri, 23 Nov 2007 19:58:45 +0000Subject: [EVP-ITC=
] Re: Family hour around the radio


I am a fairly quiet person, most of th=
e time. I have my thoughts andopinions on topics but feel strongly about "t=
o each his own". Unlesssomething strikes me as completely wrong, I won't de=
bate. No one herehas heard from me other than recently with this mini-box y=
et, I amhere several times weekly reading and offering my energy in support=
 ofthe research.However...something is striking me here and again, I can't =
keep mymouth shut. The discussion about the family hour with the box has le=
dthe way for people to mention negativity and even "the dark guys" canbe fu=
n if not taken seriously.I ask you to consider the fact that many who purch=
ase the mini-boxwill not be of the right frame of mind. Most will not be in=
 harmony.Many will take "the dark guys" seriously. Yet, you feel it's a goo=
didea to let anyone who wants a box have one? All in the name ofsharing tec=
hnology.I know that my previous posts expressing my concern over the massma=
rketing of the box, was barely given consideration. Realize that Iam not be=
ing selfish- I do not own a box. EVP is my passion and hasbeen from day one=
 6 years ago when I jumped fully into the field. I amsuccessful in capturin=
g EVP, always have been. I still do it the "oldfashioned way" with open air=
 techniques. Would I love to be able tohold real time 2 way communications =
with the other side? Of course.However, I do not think enough research into=
 the possibilities hasbeen done to warrant the approval let alone productio=
n of these boxes. Those of us who have been on countless investigations wit=
h many peoplewill quickly admit that there are some people we'd rather noti=
nvestigate with. When they are present, negative things tend tohappen. We a=
ll know one or two people who we can say "felt dark" fromthe first meeting.=
 We all admit that being mentally sound is animportant quality in this fiel=
d. If you have mental issues, this maynot be the area of research for you. =
We don't bring children oninvestigations for obvious reasons. BUT! If you w=
ant a box that couldpossibly open up a portal and bridge the gap between he=
re and thedark, sure! Anyone who wants one should have it! You might feel t=
hat I am over reacting or being overly dramatic.That's fine. My concern is =
not what you think of me but that youconsider the possibilities here. Many =
of which we do not know. Can yoube 100% sure that this is a good idea or th=
at it's worthy of saying"well, we'll see what happens"? --- In EVP-ITC@yaho=
ogroups.com, bruce halliday<paranormalinvestigating@...> wrote:>> Bill,> > =
You have the right idea, I recently have dealt with a lot> of negativity fr=
om my Frank's box. Harmony is very important> as is the right frame of mind=
 before turning the box on.> > hope you & the family had a good holiday.> >=
 Bruce> > Bruce Halliday Paranormal Investigating Team > > > To: EVP-ITC@..=
.: vilhellm@...: Fri, 23 Nov 2007 02:46:20+0000Subject: [EVP-ITC] Family ho=
ur around the radio> > > > > Maybe we're just a little unconventional in ou=
r household, but mostof us here are pretty open to the idea of the multiver=
se. Gathering ina circle around our Frank's Box is our idea of quality fami=
ly time.The messages are relevent, the interest is high, and we're very wel=
lgrounded and do not let the tricksters push us around.HappyThanksgiving fr=
om our home to yours. -Bill > > > > > > > _________________________________=
_________________________> Connect and share in new ways with Windows Live.=
>http://www.windowslive.com/connect.html?ocid=3DTXT_TAGLM_Wave2_newways_112=
007>

Your smile counts. The more smiles you share, the more we donate. Joi=
n in!
